question: Which of the following factors don't affect the demand for a commodity?
explanation: Demand for a commodity is the quantity of that commodity which an individual (or buyer) is willing to purchase at different prices within a given period of time. Market demand means the total quantity of a commodity that all its buyers are willing to purchase at different prices over a given period of time. Demand for a commodity depends on a number of factors. The important factors that affect an individual demand for a commodity are: (i) price of the commodity, (ii) income of the individual consumer, (iii) price of related goods and (iv) tastes and preferences of the individual.
